did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract:
Includes both sides of Dorothy's correspondence with Willard D. Straight; letters from friends and relatives. Also materials on civic activities, correspondence on Willard Straight Hall, and correspondence on
The New Republic and
Asia magazines.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Philanthropist, educator, publisher, patron of the arts and social activist.
Dorothy Payne Whitney, daughter of William C. Whitney, married Willard Dickerman Straight in 1911. Straight died in 1919, and she married Leonard Knight Elmhirst in 1925.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes both sides of Dorothy's correspondence with Willard D. Straight; letters from friends, and from her sister-in-law Gertrude V. Whitney and other relatives.

Also notebooks, guardianship papers, newspaper clippings, guest books and photographs documenting her early life; correspondence, newspaper clippings, and certificates for her civic activities; communications about Willard Straight's death and funeral arrangements, his will and photographs; correspondence about the building of Willard Straight Hall at Cornell University, and correspondence on
The New Republic and
Asia magazines. Major correspondents include Beatrice Bend (later Mrs. Henry Prather Fletcher), Katharine L. Barney (later Mrs. Courtlandt D. Barnes), Maurice Casenave, Herbert and Louise Croly, James Curtis, Henry P. Davison, William A. Delano, Richard Derby, Margaret (Myra) G. Dix (later Mrs. Charles Lawrance), Martin Egan, Alfred W. Fiedler, Henry Prather Fletcher, Florence (Daisy) Jaffray Harriman, Louise (Tottie) R. Knowlton (later Mrs. Buell
Hollister), and George D. Marvin.

Also, William and Caroline D. Phillips, Ethel C. Roosevelt (later Mrs. Richard Derby), Susan R. Sedgwick (widow of Arthur Swann, later Mrs. Paul L. Hammond), Hazel Straight (later Mrs. James Forest Sanborn), Eliza Morgan Swift, May Tuckerman (later Mrs. Hermann Kinnicutt), Pauline P. Whitney (later Mrs. Almeric H. Paget), Anna L.B. Williams, and Gladys M. Vanderbilt (later Countess Szechenyi), A. Piatt Andrew, J. Howland Auchincloss, Robert and Martha W. Bacon
and their son Robert Low Bacon, Frances P.B. Bolton, William J. Calhoun, Wilbur R. Chenoweth, Winston Churchill, Ellen Straight Cross, Richard Harding Davis, Charles D. Draper, Lord Charles French, John Foord, Mary Harriman (later Mrs. Charles C. Rumsey), Herbert C. Hoover, Colonel Edward M. House, Delancey K. Jay, Walter Lippmann, Charles Merz, Ruth Morgan, Annah D. Ripley (later Countess de Viel Castel), Alice L. Roosevelt (later Mrs. Nicholas Longworth), Corinne
Roosevelt (later Mrs. Douglas Robinson), Theodore Roosevelt, Elihu Root, Lillian Wald, Lloyd Warren, William Fitz Hugh (Sheldon) Whitehouse, and Stark Young.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Mayor's Committee of Women on National Defense.
Women's Emergency Committee of the European Relief Council.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS

userestrict.head: Restrictions on use:
userestrict.p: Edward C. Carter letter may not be copied.

descgrp.p: Portions of this collection are available on microfilm. The guide to the microfilm is here.

did.unittitle: Willard D. Straight to Dorothy Whitney Straight
Nov. 28, 1910 - Dec. 1, 1924, Roosevelt family to DWS
June 12, 1909 - Jan. 1, 1922, Eliza M. Swift to DWS
June 22, 1904 - Aug. 8, 1905, May Tuckerman to DWS
May 16, 1906 - Dec. 2, 1907, May T. Kinnicutt to DWS
June 17, 1908 - 1922, May T. Kinnicutt to DWS
June 16, 1909 - Mar. 2, 1922, Lillian D. Wald to DWS
Mar. 3, 1911 - May 10, 1924, Stark Young to DWS
Congratulations on Whitney W. Straight's birth, 1912
Transcripts of Correspondence (not microfilmed or indexed)
Dorothy to Beatrice Bend, Oct. 29, 1911 - Nov. 30, 1911, Jan. 9, 1912 - Jan. 19, 1912
Reprint, "A Gallant Lady"; correspondence concerning Flora P. Whitney biography - Mark Hirsh
Photos and newspaper clippings concerning W. C. Whitney, Old Westbury, Long Island (pre-1904)
Newspaper clippings concerning W. C. Whitney's death
Account of Harry P. Whitney, Dorothy's Testamentary Guardian, 1904-1908
Notes and clippings, Yale Junior Prom, 1907
Aiken, South Carolina and W. C. Whitney's houses in Westbury, Long Island and New York City
Photos of house of Mr. and Mrs. Henry B. Payne, parents of Flora P. Whitney, Dorothy's mother
Home of George Washington, Mount Vernon - photo
Dorothy's trip to Europe, 1904 - mounted photos
Photos of Dorothy and friends through 1911
World War I menu with recipes
Photos 1912-1925 (including wedding photo of Dorothy Whitney to Leonard K. Elmhirst)
Photo, 1917 (Wedding, Beatrice Bend - Henry Prather Fletcher)
Willard D. Straight in France, 1917-1918 (see also #1260, reel 7)
Appointment as Major of the infantry, July 9, 1918
Handwritten copies of cables sent and received by Dorothy during and after Willard's illness
Cable exchnage relating to Willard's illness and death (Nov. 25, 1918 - Dec. 1, 1918)
Correspondence and photos relating to "Suresnes American Cemetary and Memorial"
Financial records, 1920, 1921, 1925 (including documents relating to sale)
Photo album, Willard Straight Hall (being built)
